paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on the TTR gene variant p.Val142Ile, including penetrance data and individual records.

patients.phenotype: transthyretin cardiac amyloidosis (ATTR-CA) presenting with BRASH syndrome

individual_records.phenotype_details: presented with BRASH syndrome, severe left ventricular concentric hypertrophy, and heart failure
individual_records.evidence_sentence: Gene sequence analysis was positive for the pathogenic transthyretin (TTR) gene (p.Val142Ile), heterozygous, which is associated with autosomal dominant hereditary transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis (hATTR amyloidosis).

functional_data.summary: The variant is associated with hereditary transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis.

variants.segregation_data: The variant is associated with autosomal dominant hereditary transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis.
variants.additional_notes: The patient was diagnosed with ATTR-CA and presented with symptoms consistent with BRASH syndrome.
key_quotes: Gene sequence analysis was positive for the pathogenic transthyretin (TTR) gene (p.Val142Ile), heterozygous, which is associated with autosomal dominant hereditary transthyretin-mediated amyloidosis (hATTR amyloidosis).

extraction_metadata.notes: The extraction was straightforward as the paper provided clear information on the TTR variant.
